intro: Dalzellia pseudoangustissima, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dalzellia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
